messages: 0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c (20:07): do we have the meeting today?
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:07): Trying to call in but having technical difficulties
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:10): "the conference is restriced at this time"
0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c (20:10): tries to call once he remembers the conf code
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:15): hey, 5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e, setting up a call now
17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf (20:15): ok, 22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592; I see IA_WebApps(DOM3)2:00PM scheduled to start in 48 minutes
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (20:15): Meeting: Web Applications Working Group Teleconference
17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf (20:16): ok, 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6; conference Team_(webapps)17:13Z scheduled with code 26632 (CONF2) for 60 minutes until 1813Z
17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf (20:16): ok, 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6; the call is being made
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (20:24): ISSUE-134 -- Consider making useCapture parameter of add/removeEventListener optional -- raised
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:25): topic: ISSUE 134: Consider making useCapture parameter optional
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:26): 0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c: not sure if webidl allows this

5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:26): 0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c: if webidl already defines that it's ok to not use all the parameters, and if it defines what the default value is those cases then we dont need to care about this case at all
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:27): 0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c:  i dont like making it optional, but if webidl does that then i dont argue against that
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:27): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: right now we're not using webidl
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:27): 0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c: but if browsers implement it using webidl, and more than just idl syntax
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:28): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: if webidl allows calling native methods with fewer params than specified, then it probably defines the default values

5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:32): 5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e: provided webidl allows optional parameters and that we can specify useCapture's default to be false, we don't have a problem with it either way
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:33): 0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c: a little worried that people will understand only part of dom3 events if it is left optional
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:35): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: most people may never need it and so understanding is not necessary
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:36): 5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e: isn't this not backwards compatibile for other browsers?
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:36): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: older browsers won't have new events and such either

5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:37): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: IE before 9 didn't allow it, so there's no question there (IE6-8). Firefox/Safari/Opera/Chrome are all really aggressive about pushing updates.

5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:38): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: better to have the default that's the proper default rather than screw up people who use true/false without understanding it

5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:40): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6:  first let's look into what webidl says about this and if this is an option, if this is an available option there then we'll go ahead and make this change
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:40): Resolution: accepted. will look at webidl for this
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (20:48): ISSUE-146 -- Capture-phase listeners invoked on targets -- raised

0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c (20:48): If true, useCapture indicates that the user wishes to add the event listener for the capture phase and target only, i.e. this event listener will not be triggered during the bubbling phase. If false, the event listener must only be triggered during the target and bubbling phases.
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:50): 0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c:  once gecko implemented this, people were relying on it
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:50): RESOLUTION: Point out wording in spec to commentor.
227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6 (20:51): "Event listeners registered for this phase must handle the event once it has reached its target."
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:52): 5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e: perhaps in section 3.1 you could clarify by saying event listeners registered for either capture or bubble
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:52): 5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e: since you can't explicitly register for target phase
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (20:55): ISSUE-153 -- Converting wheel events to mousewheel and DOMMouseScroll -- raised
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:56): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: absolutely right. also correct the errors!
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (20:58): RESOLUTION: make non-normative and correct the errors
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (21:02): ISSUE-171 -- Consider removing Event.timeStamp value 0 -- raised
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (21:04): RESOLUTION: accept the comments pending further discussion
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (21:05): 0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c: in script libraries, you probably call the init method right after createEvent
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (21:05): 0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c:  the time will probably be the same
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (21:06): 0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c: if you even care about timestamp
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (21:09): 5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e: don't know how you can "guess when the event will really occur" as Boris says
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (21:11): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: he also says milliseconds since epoch might not be accurate
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (21:12): 5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e: almost all timestamps (for other environments, such as server side) are allowed to be sec since epoch
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (21:12): 5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e: so it might be useful for event timestamps to align with those systems
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (21:12): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: might be useful for animation to have these be more accurate
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (21:13): 0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c:  yes, but that might be something different
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (21:15): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: im happy to change it if there's a more concrete proposal
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (21:15): 227a9a17d1db3f8e5c71a150345fb2a6: but not sure exactly what we'd do here
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (21:15): RESOLUTION: going to keep it as epoch pending further discussion
22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592 (21:17): ISSUE-147 -- re-dispatching an event that already has its flow started -- raised
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (21:18): 0c8dce20967cf80665e60051b8ab2d3c: it would cause problems, for example, related to istrusted property
5059ecaa4fb3ab1183f267bf1613010e (21:20): RESOLUTION: clarify that it is not possible
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (21:26): I have made the request to generate http://www.w3.org/2010/10/27-webapps-minutes.html 22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592
17f9b78129866dff3cbd228a8d985fbf (21:26): sorry, 22813b6f9b851d152e2f2d99116de592, I don't know what conference this is
